error.msg: The scope of the variable 'n' can be reduced.
error.verbose: The scope of the variable 'n' can be reduced. Warning: Be careful when fixing this message, especially when there are inner loops. Here is an example where cppcheck will write that the scope for 'i' can be reduced:\012void f(int x)\012{\012 int i = 0;\012 if (x) {\012 // it's safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 for (int n = 0; n < 10; ++n) {\012 // it is possible but not safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 do_something(&i);\012 }\012 }\012}\012When you see this message it is always safe to reduce the variable scope 1 level.

error.msg: Parameter 'nums' can be declared as pointer to const
error.verbose: Parameter 'nums' can be declared as pointer to const

location.info: Parameter 'nums' can be declared as pointer to const

error.msg: int result is returned as long long value. If the return value is long long to avoid loss of information, then you have loss of information.
error.verbose: int result is returned as long long value. If the return value is long long to avoid loss of information, then there is loss of information. To avoid loss of information you must cast a calculation operand to long, for example 'return a*b;' => 'return (long)a*b'.
